title: Textarea CDATA XSS
description: User input appears inside a <textarea>. HTML inside a textarea is not rendered, so escaping the textarea is required to execute JavaScript.
objectives: Learn how to escape closing tags.
Inject active HTML after breaking out.
hints: Content inside a textarea is treated as plain text.
HTML does not execute until you break outside the textarea.
Try closing the textarea tag and injecting HTML afterwards.
body:
<article>
<textarea id="t"></textarea>
<script>
const q = new URLSearchParams(location.search).get('q') || '';
document.getElementById('t').textContent = q;
</script>
</article>
